feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays by deducting them from the working day count, and supports both calendar day and working day leave policies. Once an unpaid leave request is approved, the system automatically generates a pay deduction reflected on the payroll table. This ensures accurate salary adjustments based on the employee's leave policy and the specific month's working days.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month.

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions, with support for different calculation bases and salary component selections.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations by selecting salary components and calculation methods
To calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis for employee payroll, ensuring deductions are set off against the employee's monthly pay.
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations.
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration
Super Admins who configure leave policies and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave option.

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee before daily pay deduction is calculated and reflected on the payroll table.
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to accurately exclude weekends and public holidays when using the working days calculation base.
User must have super admin role to access and configure the Daily Wage Calculator settings
Access to Leave Settings and ability to add or modify leave policies as a Super Admin.
Super admin access to payroll settings; payroll system must be configured

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days in the month, leave policy type (calendar days or working days), and approved unpaid leave days.

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and selection of salary components to include in calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).

Selection of salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), selection of calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and configuration of eligible leave types for encashment
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (calendar days, working days, or custom days) when configuring unpaid leave deduction settings.
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, calculated daily pay rate, and deduction reflected on the payroll table.
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and visibility of which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation that applies daily deductions to be set off against the employee's monthly pay.
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on the selected calculation method; changes apply to all active (unpaid) payroll amounts

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary by actual working days, and generate the payroll deduction.
Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select a calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose salary components to factor into calculations.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (calendar days, working days, or custom days).

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and then save the new proration settings.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated using the formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) / Number of actual working days in the month. The leave policy can be based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days to arrive at the actual working days used in the calculation.

Calculation can be based on calendar days (actual days in the month), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (company-defined, commonly 30 days for UAE and KSA to comply with labor law). The selected calculation base directly impacts salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts.

Salary component selection limited to Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method options are Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days. Configuration applies to eligible paid leave types for end-of-service encashment.

Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay. Multiple calculation method options are available (Basic Only, Basic + Allowances) with multiple day calculation type options (calendar days, working days, custom days).

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted, Super admin must reject existing transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be considered and subtracted from the total working days when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with 22 working days, the daily pay calculation uses 20 days instead of 22 days.

Calendar day calculations vary by month (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February), which affects daily wage rates. Different calculation bases produce different daily wage values, so selection must align with company policy and applicable labor laws.
Super admins can view which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten when applying new leave encashment configurations
Multiple options exist for daily rate calculation including Basic Only and Basic + Allowances, requiring careful selection based on organizational payroll policies.

When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist for one or multiple employees, Super admin must manually reject those transactions before saving new salary proration changes to ensure proper application of the new calculation basis.

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: The daily wage calculator interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions, and connects with leave management systems to process approved unpaid leave requests and employee record systems.

The Daily Wage Calculator impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction. It integrates with the company's public holiday calendar and payroll settings to ensure accurate calculations.
Interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies that affect end-of-service calculations
Interacts with the payroll system by calculating daily deductions that are applied to monthly employee pay; similar to leave encashment functionality.
Interacts with the Payroll system and payroll table; affects active payroll transactions and employee compensation calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary rate used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary, computed by dividing total salary by actual working days in the month. ; Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays, used as the divisor in the daily pay calculation formula. ; Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without pay, which triggers an automatic salary deduction calculated using the daily wage calculator.

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February). Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays set up on the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: a flexible calculation base set by payroll table managers according to company policies (commonly 30 days for UAE and KSA labor law compliance).

Leave encashment: The process of converting unused leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: Final settlement calculations when an employee exits the organization. Daily Wage Calculator: Configuration tool for customizing leave encashment policies.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without pay, with deductions calculated daily based on configured settings. Daily rate calculation: The method used to determine the daily deduction amount (Basic Only, Basic + Allowances, calendar days, working days, or custom days).

Daily Wage Calculator (DWC): System component for configuring salary proration. Salary proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: Methods for determining prorated salary (custom days, calendar days, working days).
